Description: Mould-made figure in glazed composition, representing a naked ithyphallic figure, Harpokrates; represented reclining on a base approximately rectangular; wearing side lock of youth to side of head; holding his own phallus which extends right along his back to provide cushion under head; possible amuletic function of such figure, but no mean of suspension is visible and the figure is rather large; crudely made with indistinct outlines; pale greenish turquoise glaze; sandy buff, fine medium hard core; base with rubbed off corners; glaze quite worn out.
Curator's comments: This figure belongs to a popular type in 3rd and 2nd Century BC, manufactured in various materials in Naukratis. Similar parallels in glazed composition with a third century BC context at Athribis (Szymańska 1999, 73, fig. 2) and from a Ptolemaic context from the Priests' Quarter in Karnak (Masson forthcoming). Masson, A. forthcoming, Le quartier des prêtres sur la rive est du Lac Sacré à Karnak. Szymańska, H. 1999, in Grimal, N. (ed.) Tell-Edfou, soixante ans après, Actes du colloque franco-polonais, Le Caire, 15 octobre 1996, Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.103) (phase 3)
Condition: Rather fair, though bit chipped and glaze worn
